alert.note: Alert for Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:46PM EST until December 19 at 3:24AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in New Jersey... North Branch Raritan River At Raritan affecting Somerset County. For the Raritan River...including Raritan...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Branch Raritan River at Raritan. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding begins upstream on Black River Road. At 10.0 feet, Flooding occurs along Old York Road and in North Branch Village. At 13.0 feet, The first evacuations begin in Village of North Branch at Route 28 and Vaanderveer Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 PM EST Monday was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 3.6 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 09/21/1938. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date North Branch Rar Raritan 10.0 12.2 Mon 5 pm 4.4 3.7 Crested & falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM EST.
